channel.title: Great tutorial
channel.description: http://www.particle.kth.se/~lindsey/JavaCourse/Book/courseMap.html Tis a fine tutorial, or maybe a set of tutorials. Has quite a trove of good, detailed info. And it's not just that Hello World crap. Enjoy!

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“xerozcheez, post:16, topic:17345”][quote author=ada link=topic=25995.msg307967#msg307967 date=1160634442]
Hello World is crap. I started with no help or anything. I just started working on making private servers and learn’t that way. I suppose some people can’t teach themselves Java, but writing useless HelloWorld programs isn’t much better
[/quote]

That’s what I’m doing right now! I’m coding my own swing client…
Heh I learned java just from coding servers too, and then moved onto learning from clients, which uses more advanced things. :)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Blapmanjr Blapmanjr
item.description:
@Blapmanjr wrote:

nice huide its been added to my favourites so i’ll read when i have time[br][size=1]Posted at: October 19, 2006, 11:21:01 AM[/size][hr]Nice tut im thinking of creating a 3d game similar to runescape so im learning java to create one

Read full topic

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xerozcheez, post:18, topic:17345”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=25995.msg323048#msg323048 date=1161045785]

I disagree, Hello World is the beginning of programming. Private server making is the beginning of failure.

Exactly.

I don’t think copy and pasting and then complaining teaches you any programming at all
[/quote]

Actually I learnt by copying and pasting others codes then looking at them to see how each part worked and what it did, I picked up the basics of java fast with that ;)[/quote]You forgot the complaining part :X

And Rofl.

Read full topic

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:17, topic:17345”][quote author=googlethis link=topic=25995.msg310738#msg310738 date=1160718709]
I disagree, Hello World is the beginning of programming. Private server making is the beginning of failure.
[/quote]
Exactly.

I don’t think copy and pasting and then complaining teaches you any programming at all :/[/quote]

Haha, so true, that reminds me of people posting methods in the tut section, and then people replying:

“LeiK I put It Into CliEnt.JavA buT it DoeSnt works”
“You can’t simply put a method in and expect it work. You need to start it.”
“wHatz a Method?/”
“…the thing you copied and pasted”
“wHaTz Copy adn PAaste/?”
“…”

*noob makes a new topic, “HelPe ME PLeese!!1!!”

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

ada:

Hello World is crap. I started with no help or anything. I just started working on making private servers and learn’t that way. I suppose some people can’t teach themselves Java, but writing useless HelloWorld programs isn’t much better

Heh I learned java just from coding servers too, and then moved onto learning from clients, which uses more advanced things.

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

[quote=“ada, post:13, topic:17345”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=25995.msg308011#msg308011 date=1160635058]

Hello World is crap. I started with no help or anything. I just started working on making private servers and learn’t that way. I suppose some people can’t teach themselves Java, but writing useless HelloWorld programs isn’t much better
[/quote]The Hello World program is intended to give you an introduction to the structure and syntax of the language, and besides also teaching you how to simply compile and run an application, it’s intended for nothing more…you’re not supposed to learn that much from it.

Yes, but its way better to start from beyond the simpleness of HelloWorld![/quote]
I disagree, Hello World is the beginning of programming. Private server making is the beginning of failure.

Read full topic

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Hello World has been a standard technique in teaching the absolute basics of a language since the basics of modern programming…if you don’t think its of any use, thats fine, but you can’t say its all bad

Read full topic

item.title: Great tutorial
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:12, topic:17345”][quote author=ada link=topic=25995.msg307967#msg307967 date=1160634442]
Hello World is crap. I started with no help or anything. I just started working on making private servers and learn’t that way. I suppose some people can’t teach themselves Java, but writing useless HelloWorld programs isn’t much better
[/quote]The Hello World program is intended to give you an introduction to the structure and syntax of the language, and besides also teaching you how to simply compile and run an application, it’s intended for nothing more…you’re not supposed to learn that much from it.[/quote]

Yes, but its way better to start from beyond the simpleness of HelloWorld!

Read full topic

ada, hello world isn’t crap. It’s basics. Look at you for example. You didn’t use hello world, and no look what happened? You named a midi player bot. Now, with hello world, you would never make that mistake
